com.inqwell.any.jms

Interface DestinationI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Any, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    QueueI, TemporaryQueueI, TemporaryTopicI, TopicI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AnyDestination, AnyQueue, AnyTemporaryQueue, AnyTemporaryTopic, AnyTopic

    public interface DestinationI
extends Any
    Access to a JMS message within the Any framework.

    A JMS Destination does not define any methods, so this interface is really only for consistency with the other JMS wrap-ups within the Any framework and value-added Inq features

    Author:
    tom

    • Method Summary

      • setProducer

        void setProducer(MessageProducerI producer)
        Establish a producer for this destination. If a producer has been set then messages can be sent to the destination directly rather than via the associated producer

        void setConsumer(MessageConsumerI consumer)
        Establish a consumer for this destination. If a consumer has been set then messages can be synchronously received from the destination directly rather than via the associated producer
